content: ear sweaters crochet or knit skill level beginner size to fit teen/adult materials knit version 1 ball chunky wt mohair/acrylic/nubby fuzzy-blend yarn sample shown in patons divine size us 13 9 mm circular needle 16 or 20 length or set of 4 or 5 size us 13 9 mm double-pointed needles crochet version 1 ball worsted wt chenille-type yarn sample shown in caron glimmer size j/10 6 mm crochet hook both versions tapestry needle for weaving in tails gauge not critical for this project pattern notes knit ear sweater is worked in rounds on a circular needle crochet ear sweater is worked back & forth in row 1 terms/abbreviations back loop only blo beginning beg chain chain decrease decrease each ea increase increase knit k purl p repeat repeat round round slip_stitch slip_stitch stitch st stitches sts together decrease knit ear sweater note you want to have a chunky/bulky thickness for this project so depending on the weight of yarn you have chosen work with a single or double strand as necessary with single or double strand see note above cast on 36 sts join into round for circular knitting being careful not to twist sts place marker to note beg of rnds rnds 1-11 k2 p2 round 12 bind off loosely cut yarn and weave in tails crochet ear sweater row 1 with single strand of chenille or similar worsted wt yarn chain 13 single_crochet in 2nd chain from hook and in ea chain across turn 12 single_crochet row 2 chain 1 working in back loops only blo single_crochet in ea single_crochet across 12 single_crochet repeat row 2 until piece measures long enough to fit comfortably around head approx 42 row 21 ribs for adult-size head joining row holding foundation chain edge together with last row worked slip_stitch across through both thicknesses fasten_off and weave in tails copyright 2017 2008 kathy north -- www ravelry com/designers/kathy-north for personal or charity use only do not duplicate pattern for commercial purposes 2
